member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.Factory

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomAction
member.summary: Represents a custom action that appears in the Custom Actions group on the Ribbon of an Outlook item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomAction.AddressLike
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how to address the form that appears when the user executes the custom action.
member.returns: One of the values that specify how to address the target form that appears when the user executes the custom action. The default is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomAction.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how the Message or Notes field of an Outlook item is included in the reply that appears when the user executes the custom action.
member.returns: One of the values that specify how the Message or Notes field of an Outlook item is appended to the form that appears when the user executes the custom action. The default is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomAction.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the is enabled for the form region.
member.returns: true if the is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomAction.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how to respond when the user executes the custom action.
member.returns: One of the values that specify how to respond when the user executes the custom action. The default is .

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the custom action.
member.returns: A string that represents the name of the custom action.
member.exception: The value is null, or is empty.
The value is greater than 256 characters in length.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to show the in the Custom Actions group of the Ribbon that displays the form region.
member.returns: true if the appears on the Ribbon; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text that appears at the beginning of the subject line of the reply.
member.returns: A string that represents text that appears at the beginning of the subject line of the original form.
member.exception: The value is greater than 256 characters in length.

member.exception: The value is greater than 256 characters in length.
The value of the string is empty or contains the name of a message class that is not valid.

member.returns: A string that represents the name that is used to identify the custom action in the Custom Actions group of the Ribbon.

member.summary: Returns a string that represents the as XML.
member.returns: A string that represents the as XML.

member.summary: Saves the XML representation of the custom action in a string to an object.
member.param: An to which to write the string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionAddressLike
member.summary: Specifies how to address the target item that appears when the user executes the custom action.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionAddressLike.Reply
member.summary: Makes the new item a reply to the original item. If you create a new mail message, this option copies the address that appears in the From field of the message into the To field of the new message. The text that appears in the Subject field of the new message contains the text that appeared in the original Subject field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionAddressLike.ReplyAll
member.summary: Makes the new item a reply to all of the senders and recipients of the original item. If you create a new mail item, this option copies the addresses that appear in the From and To fields of the message into the To field of the target form. This option also copies the addresses that appear in the CC field of the message into the CC field of the target form. The text that appears in the Subject field of the new message contains the text that appeared in the original Subject field.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionAddressLike.Forward
member.summary: Makes the new item a forward of the original item. If you create a new mail message, this option clears the To and CC fields of the new message. The text that appears in the Subject field of the new message contains the text that appeared in the original Subject field. The attachments on the original item are copied to the new item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionAddressLike.ReplyToFolder
member.summary: If you create a new Post item, this option posts the item to the active folder. This item also copies the text that appears in the Subject field into the Conversation field of the new item. It then clears the Subject field of the new item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionAddressLike.Response
member.summary: Causes the custom action button to appear when you click the Vote button in the Respond group of the Ribbon.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionBody
member.summary: Specifies how the Message or Notes field of an Outlook item is included to the reply that appears when the user executes the custom action.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionBody.Omit
member.summary: The reply contains no references to the original item or the text of the original item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionBody.Attach
member.summary: The reply includes the original item as an attachment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionBody.Include
member.summary: The reply includes the text of the original item. This text appears in the body of the reply.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionBody.Indent
member.summary: The reply includes the text of the original item. The text is indented in the body of the reply.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionBody.Prefix
member.summary: The reply includes the text of the original item. The text appears in the body of the reply. Each line of text is preceded by the prefix that you specify for the property of the .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionCustomActionBody.User
member.summary: The reply includes the text of the original item. The text appears in the body of the reply. The text in the Subject field uses the default prefix. For example, if you set the property of the to , the text in the Subject field is preceded by "RE:".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionType
member.summary: Specifies the way the form region appears in Microsoft Office Outlook.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionType.Adjoining
member.summary: Appends the form region to the bottom of an Outlook form's default page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionType.Replacement
member.summary: Adds the form region as a new page that replaces the default page of an Outlook form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionType.ReplaceAll
member.summary: Replaces the whole Outlook form with the form region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionType.Separate
member.summary: Adds the form region as a new page in an Outlook form.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.ImportedFormRegion.GetFormRegionControl(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified control from the Microsoft.Vbe.Interop.Forms.UserForm of the form region.
member.returns: The control that is specified by .
member.param: The name of the control that you would like to locate in the Microsoft.Vbe.Interop.Forms.UserForm of the form region.
member.exception: The form region specified by the property is null.
Identifier does not match a control in the .ofs file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.OutlookAddIn

member.name: E:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.OutlookAddIn.FormRegionFactoryResolve
member.summary: Occurs when the add-in loads, and when a form region name that is specified in the registry does not match the name of any form regions defined in the add-in.
